View Event → Sep 20 Downtown Street Market Saturday, September 20, 2025 10:00 AM 2:00 PM Google Calendar ICS Step back in time and explore the artistry of handcrafted goods at the Downtown Street Market! This month, we’re bringing a special twist with the Vintage & Homemade Goods Market, where nostalgia meets creativity in a showcase of timeless treasures and artisan craftsmanship. Join us on Saturday, September 20th, 2025, from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM as S Brooksville Ave transforms into a vibrant marketplace filled with antique finds, repurposed goods, and one-of-a-kind handmade items. Shoppers will discover a curated selection of vintage décor, upcycled furniture, artisan crafts, and specialty foods, all while supporting local entrepreneurs and small businesses. In addition to incredible shopping, guests can enjoy delicious food, and the welcoming atmosphere of Brooksville’s historic downtown district. Whether you're a collector, a lover of handmade goods, or simply looking for a fun way to spend a Saturday, this market is for you! This event is family-friendly and pet-friendly. Bring your friends, bring your pets, and experience the magic of shopping local in downtown Brooksville. View Event → Oct 18 Downtown Street Market Saturday, October 18, 2025 10:00 AM 2:00 PM Google Calendar ICS Get ready to welcome Fall with a day of festive fun, delicious flavors, and local shopping at the Downtown Street Market! Brooksville Main Street is excited to host a special edition of the market featuring a Fall Festival and Chili Cook-Off, bringing the community together for a celebration of all things fall. Join us on Saturday, October 18th, from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM as S Brooksville Ave transforms into a lively marketplace filled with seasonal décor, handmade crafts, and specialty food vendors. Visitors can explore a variety of fall-themed treats, shop unique artisan goods, and enjoy festive activities for the whole family! Chili Cook-Off Showdown! One of this month’s market highlights will be a fun Chili Cook-Off where local chefs and home cooks will compete for the title of Best Chili in Brooksville! Attendees can sample a variety of chili recipes and vote for their favorite while enjoying entertainment and the warm, welcoming atmosphere of historic downtown. CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP FOR THE CHILI COOK OFF Guests can also enjoy music, kids' activities, and festive photo opportunities, making it a can’t-miss event for all ages. The Downtown Street Market is a family-friendly and pet-friendly event, so bring your loved ones—both two-legged and four-legged—for a day of fun and festivities. View Event → Nov 8 to Nov 9 9/11 Never Forget Mobile Exhibit Sat, Nov 8, 2025 10:00 AM Sun, Nov 9, 2025 4:30 PM 115 North Main Street Brooksville, FL, 34601 United States (map) Google Calendar ICS Brooksville Main Street is honored to welcome back the powerful Tunnel to Towers Foundation 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to downtown Brooksville! This moving experience offers a profound opportunity to remember the events of September 11, 2001, and pay tribute to the enduring sacrifices made by so many heroes. Step inside this 83-foot tractor-trailer, transformed into an 1,100-square-foot mobile museum, and encounter poignant artifacts from Ground Zero, including World Trade Center steel and fragments from that fateful day. Hear firsthand accounts from retired New York City Firefighters and first responders who were there, as they share their powerful experiences and memories. The return of the Tunnel to Towers 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to Brooksville has been made possible through the generous support of Buick GMC Brooksville, Advent Health Dade City and Massage Envy Spring Hill Brooksville. The exhibit will be open to the public on these dates: Saturday, November 8th: 10:00 AM – 4:30 PM Sunday, November 9th: 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM Let us come together as a community to NEVER FORGET. Learn more about the vital work of the Tunnel to Towers Foundation at T2T.org. View Event → Nov 15 Downtown Street Market Saturday, November 15, 2025 10:00 AM 2:00 PM Google Calendar ICS Join us in honoring our nation’s heroes at a special edition of the monthly Downtown Street Market! Brooksville Main Street is proud to present the final market of 2025 with a Salute to Veterans, a heartfelt tribute celebrating the service and sacrifice of our military veterans. This patriotic street market will bring the community together for a day of appreciation, local shopping, and family-friendly activities. Join us on Saturday, November 15th, 2025 from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM as S Brooksville Ave transforms into a bustling marketplace filled with veteran-owned businesses, handmade crafts, specialty food trucks, and unique goods. Attendees will also have the opportunity to engage with veteran organizations and learn more about ways to support our military community. This event is not only a celebration of their service but also a way for our community to come together in gratitude and support. The Downtown Street Market is a family-friendly and pet-friendly event, so bring your loved ones—both two-legged and four-legged—for a day of fun and festivities while enjoying the welcoming atmosphere of historic downtown Brooksville View Event → Nov 29 Small Business Saturday 2025 Saturday, November 29, 2025 10:00 AM 2:00 PM Google Calendar ICS More details coming soon! View Event → Dec 6 Christmas on Main Tree Lighting 2025 Saturday, December 6, 2025 3:00 PM 9:00 PM Google Calendar ICS Brooksville’s premiere Christmas event is back! Step into a holiday wonderland as downtown Brooksville transforms into a magical scene straight out of your favorite Hallmark movie! Here’s what’s in store for this unforgettable evening: Sounds of the Season Stroll the streets with our enchanting Street Carolers, serenading you with your favorite holiday classics. At 6pm, Patricia’s Boutique Windows “Come to Life” with festive surprises! Brooksville Methodist Church will have a live Nativity scene and a petting zoo in the Brooksville Commons Tree Lighting Spectacular Join us for the official Tree Lighting Ceremony at 7 PM and watch downtown glow with holiday cheer! A special performance by the talented Live Oak Theatre will fill the air with seasonal joy. Meet Santa Claus The big man himself will be waiting to hear everyone’s Christmas wishes—don’t forget your camera! Shop & Celebrate Browse the Christmas Craft Market and check off your gift list at downtown shops open late. Find unique treasures and handmade goodies for everyone on your list. Festive Flavors Indulge in delicious bites from downtown restaurants and visiting food trucks serving up holiday-inspired treats. A Magical Night to Remember Come share in the holiday spirit with family and friends as we celebrate the most wonderful time of the year. This is a night you won’t want to miss! Bundle up, bring your holiday cheer, and let’s make this a magical start to the season! View Event → Dec 19 Family Sensory Christmas Celebration Friday, December 19, 2025 5:00 PM 9:00 PM Google Calendar ICS This holiday season, prepare to be swept away by the timeless, heartwarming magic of Christmas! Brooksville Main Street is absolutely delighted to announce the return of its 3rd Annual Family Sensory Christmas Celebration on Friday, December 19th, 2025, from 5:00 PM to 9:00 PM at Hernando Park, located at 205 E Ft Dade Ave in charming downtown Brooksville. This truly special evening is thoughtfully designed to create an inclusive and memorable holiday experience for families with children of all abilities, especially those with sensory sensitivities. Imagine a cozy, old-fashioned Christmas evening, bursting with the gentle glow of holiday cheer and candy-themed delights. Think classic candy canes, whimsical gum drops, and a sprinkling of pure holiday sparkle – all lovingly crafted for everyone to enjoy in a calm, sensory-friendly atmosphere. The only missing ingredient is you and your loved ones! Highlights of this enchanting evening include: Sensory-Sensitive Santa Visit: Experience the wonder of meeting Santa Claus in a calm and quiet setting. This allows for truly personalized interactions without the hustle, bustle, long lines, or loud noises often found at traditional events. It's a cherished moment just for your family. Low-Sensory Activities: Discover a delightful array of holiday-themed crafts, engaging sensory play stations, and activities meticulously designed to engage the senses in a gentle, comforting way. Movie Magic Meadow : Settle down under the stars to enjoy a beloved classic Christmas film in the serene setting of the park. Wrap up in blankets and enjoy a nostalgic cinematic treat. Christmas Craft Market: Wander through a charming market where local artisans, crafters, and food vendors gather, offering handcrafted gifts and festive treats perfect for that special holiday touch. "We believe the magic of Christmas should be accessible to every family, creating joyful memories that last a lifetime," said Christopher Rhodes, Board President of Brooksville Main Street . " The Family Sensory Christmas Celebration is our way of offering a truly inclusive event, allowing everyone to savor the wonder of the season in a way that feels comfortable and joyful for them." View Event → Dec 31 to Jan 1 NYE Tangerine Ball Drop Wed, Dec 31, 2025 7:00 PM Thu, Jan 1, 2026 12:30 AM Google Calendar ICS Prepare to send 2025 off with a bang and welcome 2026 in the most vibrant way possible! Brooksville Main Street and “Tangerine” Presenting Partner, Lowman Law Firm , is thrilled to announce the return of the Tangerine Ball Drop , promising an exhilarating New Year's Eve celebration on Wednesday, December 31st, 2025, from 6:00 PM to 1:00 AM at the iconic Water Tower in downtown Brooksville! This isn't just any countdown; it's a unique, colorful twist on tradition, featuring a dazzling, glowing tangerine descending to mark the very start of the New Year! This signature event is your ticket to an unforgettable New Year's Eve bash, packed with non-stop excitement! Immerse yourself in live music that will make you move, tantalizing treats from an array of food trucks, a vibrant NYE Night Market for those last-minute celebratory finds, an exclusive VIP area, and a lively, family-friendly atmosphere that promises fun for all ages. Whether you're craving a night of epic dancing, a feast of delicious eats, or simply a spectacular evening out with friends and family, the NYE Tangerine Ball Drop has something electrifying for everyone! The evening's pulse-pounding celebration kicks off when local sensation DJ Shalamar takes the stage, ready to ignite the dance floor! Known for his seamless blending of today’s hottest hits, timeless classics, and everything in between, his infectious energy is guaranteed to keep the party pumping. From chart-toppers to throwback favorites, partygoers can expect an epic soundtrack to usher in the New Year with unparalleled style. And here's a special treat for our younger revelers: when the clock strikes 9:00 PM, families can expect a unique, early ball drop just for the kiddos! But the fun is far from over! Get ready for a high-octane performance as Best of the Bay Rock Band, Women of Rock , takes the stage at 9:30 PM! These incredible performers will show you why they're masters at keeping the energy soaring throughout the evening. They'll be joined by Mayor Christa Tanner for a live, electrifying countdown to midnight, culminating in the spectacular Tangerine Ball Drop ! Watch in awe as the iconic tangerine illuminates the night sky, making its magnificent descent to thunderous cheers from the crowd as we officially welcome 2026! Admission to this sensational event is FREE , so bring the whole family and soak in all the excitement! For those looking to elevate their New Year's Eve experience to the next level, an exclusive VIP Experience awaits. VIP EXPERIENCE: Tickets are available for $45 per person or $75 per couple. Indulge in complimentary dishes from beloved local restaurants Sip on signature festive drinks, raise a glass with a champagne toast at midnight Snag an exclusive swag bag Uncover a few more delightful surprises! This year’s Tangerine Ball Drop promises to be the grandest yet, with the tangerine glowing brighter than ever before! Come dressed to impress or keep it casual, but be sure to bring your wildest New Year's spirit as we count down to an unforgettable 2026! "Our New Year’s Eve party is all about creating a night to remember, a true spectacle of celebration," said Christopher Rhodes , Board President of Brooksville Main Street . "With DJ Shalamar kicking off the night and then passing the baton to the electrifying Women of Rock , this is going to be the ultimate celebration to kick off 2026 in the best way possible!" View Event → Mar 22 Pedal Play Day 2025 Saturday, March 22, 2025 11:00 AM 2:00 PM Google Calendar ICS Pedal Play Day Rolls into Brooksville to Celebrate the Good Neighbor Trail Get ready to ride! Brooksville Main Street in partnership with Florida’s Adventure Coast Brooksville Weeki Wachee and Bike Florida is excited to host Pedal Play Day , a fun-filled community event celebrating the Good Neighbor Trail. Cyclists of all ages and skill levels are invited to join us on Saturday, March 22nd from 10am-2pm in Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville for a day of biking, family activities, and local fun. Pedal Play Day aims to inspire a love for cycling, foster community engagement, and raise awareness of the Good Neighbor Trail as a resource for health, recreation, and eco-tourism. The event will feature group rides, safety demonstrations, a bicycle decorating station, interactive stations promoting fitness and wellness and special appearances from local cycling enthusiasts. Attendees can also explore local vendor booths, food trucks, and participate in prize giveaways. Don’t forget to bring your bike and helmet! We’ll also have bicycle rides through the Good Neighbor Trail throughout the day of varying lengths. This family-friendly event encourages cycling for all ages and skill levels, providing a safe and engaging environment for participants to explore the trail and connect with others. Malloy as its Executive Director. Mr. Malloy comes to the Brooksville Main Street program from Heritage Homes Realty in St. Petersburg where he served as owner and CEO of a multi-million dollar real estate sales business. Mr. Malloy has a reputation as a talented individual with a fervent passion for the field of historic preservation. He has a long-standing career with a wide variety of positions held in hotel, banking, restaurant, real estate and especially project management. From 2012 to 2014 he served as Senior Development Specialist of the Edwards Group, which managed and oversaw the construction of a $50 million construction project. Mr. Malloy holds a Master of Arts degree from Savannah College of Art & Design in historic preservation with degree emphasis on preservation advocacy and conservation techniques. He also holds a BAS in sustainability management from St. Petersburg College. Mr. Malloy also comes to Brooksville Main Street program with an extensive background in nonprofit leadership. He currently serves as a member of the board and former secretary to St. Petersburg Preservation and a board trustee and treasurer for Florida Trust for Historic Preservation. “I see the tremendous potential for revitalization through the National Trust Main Street Program’s four point approach. I believe that with the joint efforts of both the public and private sectors, the Brooksville Main Street program is definitely poised for success,” said Mr. Malloy. About Brooksville Main Street Powered by the Brooksville Vision Foundation, the Brooksville Main Street program aims to bring economic growth, vitality and historic preservation to one of Old Florida’s most iconic small towns. Brooksville Main Street is an official “Florida Main Street Community” as designated by the Bureau of Historic Preservation, Division of Historical Resources and the Florida Department of State. “Dedicated to the re-imagined vitality and economic prosperity of one of Old Florida’s most iconic small towns.” Visit us at www.BrooksvilleMainStreet.org . To contact Brooksville Main Street, write to Ryan A. Malloy, Executive Director, Brooksville Main Street, PO Box 1323, Brooksville, Florida 34605, or call 352-540-6409, or email director@brooksvillemainstreet.org . About Us | Main Street Gardnerville ABOUT About Us Contact History Meetings News DOING BUSINESS DOWNTOWN Small Business Resource Guide Business Licenses & Permits Façade Improvement Grant Program Additional Resources & FAQ’s EVENTS Annual Events Events Calendar Partnerships & Registrations HERITAGE PARK GARDENS INTERACTIVE MAP PARTNERS Partners Become a Partner (Business) PUBLIC ART VOLUNTEER Current Volunteers Volunteer DONATE SUBSCRIBE Select Page Our Mission The mission of the Main Street Gardnerville Program, in partnership with our stakeholders, is to revitalize downtown Gardnerville utilizing design, organization, promotion & district vitality to develop the unique identity and preserve the historic nature of our community. Governed by a Board of Directors, Main Street Gardnerville is composed of stakeholders of the area who are interested in the revitalization and preservation of our Downtown. Main Street Gardnerville is neither a business association nor a chamber, but rather, an association of people who promote and protect a place. We receive training and technical support from the National Main Street Center. Main Street Gardnerville (MSG) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with a focus on revitalization and preservation in Gardnerville, Nevada. Join us at one of our upcoming events! OUR STAFF Jen Tune Executive Director Minos Dobson Program Assistant & Volunteer Coordinator BOARD OF DIRECTORS & COMMITTEE CHAIRS Deborah Ham Retired President Daphne Hillyer Carson Valley Health President Elect & Promo Committee Co-Chair Sophia Roussakis Realtor Secretary Rachel Gasporra Licensed Mortgage Loan Officer Treasurer & Promo Committee Co-Chair Mysta Townsell-Tucker Baker Hughes Past President & Design Committee Chair Mike Olson Farmers Insurance Member Rocky Walling Town of Gardnerville Board Appointed Town Liaison Meredith Fischer Eddy Street Vintage Market Member & District Vitality Chair Whitney Bullion Banker Member & Organization Chair Linda Dibble Retired Flower Subcommittee Chair Donna Werner Retired Heritage Park Gardens Subcommittee Chair Main Street Gardnerville proudly holds the distinction of being the first community in Nevada to earn the Main Street designation, and it remains one of only three Accredited Main Street America Programs in the state. In our historic downtown district, we honor our heritage while actively planning for a vibrant future in the 21st century. Gardnerville is home to passionate business owners and community members who work every day to ensure our downtown remains lively, welcoming, and economically strong. Take a moment to explore our town, and you’ll discover a truly authentic and thriving American downtown. Whether you’re here for business or simply visiting, we invite you to explore our website and find exactly what you’re looking for. CONTACT US 1420 U.S. Highway 395 N, Suite C, Gardnerville, NV 89410 info@mainstreetgardnerville.org | (775) 782-8027 Follow Follow • Experience the Past • Enrich the Present • Embrace the Future • © 2025 Main Street Gardnerville All Rights Reserved

Submission Form FAQs Invest Eat Local Eat Local Eat Local (Pictured: The Bistro. Photo courtesy Roots Creative Co. ) Dine with us in Downtown Brooksville! Family-owned restaurants line the city streets here in Brooksville. Whether you’re looking for Southern eats or international cuisine, we’ve got something for you! Start your day with craft coffee, visit a local eatery for a light lunch, or save room for a homemade dessert. We know you’ll come back for more! Eat, drink and enjoy local eats! We strive for accuracy in our directory. If you come across any missing listings, kindly contact us to let us know, and we'll make sure to update it promptly. Your engagement helps us create a better experience for everyone! The Bistro Nestled in the heart of Brooksville, The Bistro offers a charming and intimate dining experience perfect for both casual outings and special occasions. Known for its delicious contemporary  cuisine, the restaurant prides itself on using fresh, locally sourced ingredients to create flavorful dishes. Whether you're stopping by for a quick lunch or enjoying a leisurely dinner, The Bistro’s cozy ambiance and friendly service make it a local favorite. The Bistro also caters and hosts for events! 10 S Main Street, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Boon•dog•gle Eats A hidden gem in Brooksville, Boondoggle Eats brings a fun, laid-back atmosphere where comfort food meets creativity. Known for its delicious, hearty meals and friendly service, Boondoggle Eats offers a variety of mouth-watering dishes that are sure to please any palate. From juicy burgers and crispy fries to fresh salads and hearty sandwiches, each dish is prepared with care and the finest ingredients. The restaurant’s unique twist on classic comfort foods, paired with its casual and welcoming vibe, makes it a must-visit spot for both locals and visitors alike. Whether you’re grabbing a quick bite or settling in for a relaxed meal with friends, Boondoggle Eats offers a taste of Brooksville's best. Bring your pup and enjoy the porch like atmosphere! Be sure to check out their daily specials! 13 S Brooksville Ave, Fl, Brooksville, FL 34601 Facebook Bread Box Bakery For freshly baked treats and a cozy, welcoming atmosphere, Bread Box Bakery in Brooksville is the place to be. This charming bakery is a local favorite, offering a wide variety of artisanal breads, pastries, and sweets made from scratch daily. Whether you’re craving a warm loaf of sourdough, a buttery croissant, or a decadent slice of cake, Bread Box Bakery delivers on quality and taste with every bite. The bakery also features a selection of savory items like sandwiches and quiches, perfect for breakfast or lunch. With its inviting ambiance, friendly staff, and mouthwatering aromas, Bread Box Bakery is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to indulge in delicious, homemade baked goods. Bread Box Bakery also hosts baking classes! 304 Fort Dade Ave, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Broad Street Brewing Company Crafted with passion and community in mind, Broad Street Brewing Company is where exceptional brews and local flavor come together. This laid-back brewery in the heart of Brooksville offers a selection of handcrafted beers, all brewed on-site using quality ingredients and time-honored techniques. With a cozy taproom and welcoming atmosphere, it's the perfect place to relax, enjoy a cold pint, and chat with friends or fellow beer enthusiasts. Excellent place with fun events and live music! Whether you're a casual drinker or a connoisseur, Broad Street Brewing Company prides itself on offering unique flavors that celebrate the local culture and community spirit. 291 E Jefferson St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Coney Island Drive Inn Step back in time at Coney Island Drive Inn, a beloved Brooksville institution serving up classic American fast food with a nostalgic twist. This charming drive-in offers a variety of crave-worthy favorites, from hot dogs and crispy fries to milkshakes, all served in a fun, retro setting. Whether you're grabbing a quick bite on the go or enjoying a casual meal with family and friends, Coney Island Drive Inn is the perfect place to satisfy your cravings. The friendly service, delicious comfort food, and old-school vibe make it a must-visit spot for both locals and visitors looking for a taste of Brooksville’s history. ‘Eat where Elvis ate!’ 1112 E Jefferson St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Downtown Loser For a healthy, energizing boost in Downtown Brooksville, Downtown Loser is the place to be. Located in a historic gas station, and specializing in shakes and teas, this vibrant spot offers a variety of delicious, nutrient-packed options to fuel your day. Whether you’re looking for a refreshing tea, a creamy protein shake, or a custom blend to fit your needs, Downtown Loser has something for everyone. With a welcoming, upbeat atmosphere, it’s the perfect spot to grab a post-workout drink, meet up with friends, or simply enjoy a healthy treat. The friendly staff is always ready to help you find the perfect shake or tea to suit your taste and dietary goals. Come for the delicious drinks, stay for the positive vibes! 202 S Broad Street, Brooksville, FL 34601 Facebook Page Enchilada's Mexican Restaurant For a taste of authentic Mexican cuisine, Enchiladas in Brooksville is a must-visit. This vibrant restaurant serves up a wide variety of traditional dishes, from their signature enchiladas filled with flavorful fillings to mouthwatering tacos, sizzling fajitas, and rich, savory burritos. Each dish is made with fresh ingredients and bold spices, offering a true taste of Mexico. The portions are generous, ensuring you'll leave satisfied, whether you're in the mood for something spicy or a comforting, cheesy delight. With its casual and laid-back atmosphere, Enchiladas is the perfect spot to enjoy a meal with family, friends, or even a solo bite when you're craving something delicious and hearty. 128 N. Broad St., Brooksville, FL 34601 Facebook Page Florida Cracker Cook Shack For a true taste of Southern BBQ with a Florida twist, Florida Cracker Cook Shack is a must-visit. This local favorite serves up mouthwatering BBQ dishes like tender pulled pork, juicy ribs, and smoky brisket, all cooked low and slow to perfection. The restaurant takes pride in using fresh, local ingredients and offering unique twists on classic BBQ flavors, with signature sauces and seasonings that reflect the spirit of Florida’s diverse culinary heritage. Whether you're craving a plate of sizzling meats or a flavorful sandwich, Florida Cracker Cook Shack delivers an unforgettable BBQ experience in a casual, welcoming setting. 511 S Broad St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Florida Cracker Kitchen Step into Florida Cracker Kitchen for a hearty, Southern-inspired meal with a distinct Florida flair. This beloved local spot serves up a menu brimming with classic comfort foods, from flavorful biscuits and gravy to savory country-fried steak, all made with a unique Florida twist. Whether you're stopping by for breakfast or lunch, the relaxed atmosphere and friendly service make it the perfect place to enjoy a delicious meal that captures the essence of Florida’s rich culinary traditions. 966 E Jefferson St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Florida Cracker Tap Room & Bourbon Bar For a great selection of beers and a lively, laid-back atmosphere, Florida Cracker Tap Room is the place to be. This popular local hangout offers a wide variety of beers on tap, many from Florida-based breweries, alongside a delicious menu of pub favorites like juicy burgers, crispy wings, pizzas, and flavorful appetizers. Whether you're a beer enthusiast or just looking for a fun spot to unwind, Florida Cracker Tap Room combines the best of craft beer culture with a warm, inviting vibe. It's the perfect place to gather with friends, watch the game, or simply enjoy a cold drink and great food. 966 E Jefferson St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Click Here Frosty Franks Frosty Franks is the ultimate destination for sweet treats and nostalgia in Brooksville. Specializing in Hershey’s Ice Cream, glass-bottled sodas, and vintage candies, this charming spot brings back the joy of classic indulgence. From creamy scoops of ice cream to refreshing sodas and a variety of old-fashioned candies, it’s the perfect place to satisfy your sweet tooth and relive the flavors of yesteryear. Whether you're treating yourself to a milkshake or picking out your favorite retro candy, Frosty Franks offers a fun and delicious escape for all ages. 1032 E Jefferson St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Facebook Page Good Time Good Time in Brooksville is a vibrant spot that offers a unique mix of natural wines, Florida craft beers, specialty coffee, and creative mocktails. Known for its sweet treats, including delicious ice cream, this place has something for everyone, whether you’re looking for a relaxing drink or a refreshing dessert. Good Time frequently hosts a variety of food trucks, bringing in new flavors and exciting options for every visit. Along with their rotating food truck offerings, Good Time also hosts a range of fun events throughout the week, making it a perfect spot for gathering with friends, enjoying great food and drinks, and experiencing the lively community atmosphere. 500 S Broad St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Green Door on Broad Green Door on Broad brings elevated Southern cuisine to the heart of Brooksville, blending charm, creativity, and comfort in every bite. Known for its welcoming atmosphere and attention to detail, this locally beloved restaurant offers a dining experience that feels both upscale and approachable. The menu showcases a refined take on Southern classics—think slow-braised meats, buttery biscuits, seasonal vegetables, and rich, flavorful sauces—all made from scratch using thoughtfully sourced ingredients. Whether you're enjoying a laid-back lunch, a romantic dinner, or gathering with friends for weekend brunch, Green Door on Broad delivers dishes that are both soulful and beautifully presented. The restaurant’s rustic-chic interior and attentive service create a space that’s as inviting as the food itself. Guests can also enjoy a carefully curated drink menu, featuring handcrafted cocktails, select wines, and regional beers that pair perfectly with the menu's rich flavors. 4 N Broad St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Instagram Page Ice Cream Barr For a sweet escape in Brooksville, Ice Cream Barr is the place to go! This charming family owned and operated shop specializes in a wide variety of ice cream flavors, offering everything from classic favorites to unique, indulgent combinations. All ice cream is made by the family with fresh ingredients, many of which are local to Brooksville! Whether you're in the mood for a scoop, a sundae, or a creamy milkshake, Ice Cream Barr serves up delicious treats that are sure to satisfy your sweet tooth. With a fun, welcoming atmosphere, it’s the perfect spot for families, friends, and anyone craving a cool treat. 500 S Broad St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website The Lazy Maid Crêperie Step into The Lazy Maid Crêperie, where French-inspired charm meets mouthwatering flavors in Brooksville. This family-owned gem offers a delightful menu full of sweet and savory crêpes, made with fresh ingredients and served with a dash of creativity. From decadent Nutella-filled crêpes to savory combinations there’s something to satisfy every craving. The charming interior, adorned with colorful umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, adds a whimsical touch that transports you straight to a quaint French café. Whether you're stopping by for a leisurely breakfast, brunch, or an afternoon treat, the warm, inviting atmosphere and friendly service make it the perfect spot for families and friends to enjoy a relaxed, delicious meal together. 419 Howell Ave, Brooksville, FL 34601 Facebook Page Main Street Eatery Located off of Main Street, Main Street Eatery offers a cozy and inviting spot for delicious, homemade meals with a touch of Southern charm. Known for its delicious Cuban Sandwich, the menu features a variety of dishes, from savory sandwiches to mouthwatering daily specials. With a focus on great service and community, Main Street Eatery is the perfect place to relax, enjoy a satisfying meal, and experience the best of what Brooksville has to offer. Don’t forget the delicious, made in house, ice box pies! 101 N. Main Street, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Mallie Kyla's Mallie Kyla's Cafe is a charming spot offering a menu full of delicious homemade comfort food. From fresh salads and sandwiches to mouthwatering daily specials, each dish is crafted with care using high-quality ingredients. This cozy café is the perfect place to enjoy a leisurely brunch, a satisfying lunch, or a sweet treat with friends and family. With its welcoming atmosphere and exceptional service, Mallie Kyla's Cafe provides a relaxed yet vibrant dining experience, making it a local favorite for both casual outings and special moments. Do not miss out on their phenomenal cakes! 510 E. Liberty St., Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Mountaineer Coffee Nature Coast Roasted — For coffee lovers in Brooksville, Mountaineer Coffee is a must-visit. This cozy, rustic café offers an inviting atmosphere where you can enjoy expertly brewed coffee made from high-quality beans sourced from around the world. Whether you're in the mood for a bold espresso, a rich latte, or a refreshing cold brew, Mountaineer Coffee has something to satisfy every coffee craving. In addition to their exceptional drinks, they also serve a variety of pastries and light bites, perfect for pairing with your favorite brew. With its warm, welcoming vibe and a true passion for coffee, Mountaineer Coffee is the ideal spot to relax, meet friends, or get some work done while sipping on a perfect cup. 26 S. Broad St., Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Taipei Taipei Tea House Experience a taste of Taiwan in Brooksville at Taipei Taipei Tea House. This charming tea house specializes in authentic Taiwanese teas and bubble tea, offering a wide variety of flavors, from classic milk teas to refreshing fruit-infused options. Each drink is made with high-quality ingredients and can be customized with your choice of toppings, including chewy tapioca pearls and fruity bursts. In addition to their famous teas, Taipei Taipei Tea House offers a huge selection of Taiwanese food making it a perfect spot for a lunch with large portions. With its cozy ambiance and friendly service, it’s a great place to relax, enjoy a delicious drink, and explore the flavors of Taiwan. 322 N Broad St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Facebook Page The Tilted Tea Cup Tea Room Step into The Titled Tea Cup for a cozy and elegant tea experience in Brooksville. This charming tea room offers a wide selection of fine teas, ranging from classic black and green varieties to unique blends that cater to every palate. Paired with their carefully crafted menu of delicious scones, finger sandwiches, and decadent pastries, it’s the perfect place to indulge in a traditional afternoon tea or enjoy a light bite in a relaxing atmosphere. With its quaint décor and friendly service, The Titled Tea Cup provides a welcoming space for tea lovers, groups of friends, or anyone looking to unwind with a soothing cup of tea. 410 E Liberty St, Brooksville, FL 34601 Website Office 205 E Fort Dade Avenue Brooksville, FL 34601 Hours Monday — Friday 9:00am — 5pm Contact executivedirector@welovebvl.org 352-540-6409 Sign up for our newsletter! Executive Director Dawn is one who is passionate about serving a purpose greater than self. She is genuinely dedicated to understanding others, which naturally builds and nurtures personal and professional relationships. She is an accomplished, goal-driven professional with over 25 years of experience in the Operations, Marketing, Accounting and Non-Profit sectors. With extensive experience managing multiple projects, Dawn has a proven track record of delivering, planning and executing marketing campaigns and events. Dawn served as finance director for United Way of Hernando County. Moving to new opportunities, she accepted a position with Greater Hernando County Chamber of Commerce as their event coordinator and later was promoted to Director of Operations. More recently, Dawn spent four years in Wolfeboro, New Hampshire enjoying life on Lake Winnipesaukee, while serving as the Executive Director for Intown Concord producing events and programs that encouraged economic vitality to downtown Concord NH.  She’s excited to be part of the Brooksville Main Street community and is looking forward to the many adventures that await! Staff Cassandra Brockway, Event Director Cassandra is an accomplished Operations Manager with a proven track record in the stock transfer industry, specializing in project management and operational leadership. With a keen ability to streamline processes and drive efficiency, Cassandra has consistently delivered impactful results in fast-paced environments. In addition to her professional expertise, she is deeply committed to the Brooksville community, bringing energy and vitality to local initiatives. As a leader, she combines strategic vision with a passion for fostering growth and collaboration, both in her workplace and within her community. Cassandra grew up in England, moving to the U.S. in 2014 she brought with her a fresh perspective and a global approach to her professional career. Her journey from England to the U.S. has shaped her unique perspective on leadership, community, and the value of diverse experiences in both her professional and personal life. She looks forward to working with Brooksville Main Street to work to add to the charm of Brooksville. 2025 Board of Directors Christopher Rhodes, Board President & Design Committee Co-Chair Although Chris only moved to Brooksville from Hudson in 2021, he has been visiting it for decades. He is a mental health therapist by trade and a historic preservationist by passion. His spare time is spent renovating his over 100-year-old home in our South Brooksville Avenue Historic District and in photographing our city. Chris shares his home with his loving wife Lauren, their dog, five cats (3 of which came with his home). His favorite BMS event is Christmas on Main, which he can walk to as it is just a couple of blocks from his home. However, the Tangerine Ball Drop may be coming in at a close second! Jody Young, Board Vice-President Jody first came to Brooksville in the 1980s when her parents bought a home here and then moved here herself in 1999. Jody's career for many years involved serving in local government finance/administration but has most recently begun working for Edmunds GovTech as a Customer Support Specialist Level III providing financial software support to governmental clients around the country. Jody loves both national and international travel, but also very much enjoys fishing locally on their boat and spending time outdoors on the Adventure Coast with her husband Brent, three adult sons, 2 grandchildren, and their sweet dog Molly. Christmas on Main Street events are her favorite BMS-hosted activities; she loves the physical transformation of the downtown as well as the joy the activities bring to all those who attend. Amanda Cunningham-Rud, Board Secretary Amanda was raised in rural Northwest Indiana near Chicago. Early in life, Amanda was exposed to the concept of public service as her grandfather and other family members served the State of Indiana in various elected roles. She moved to Florida with her husband in 2011.  Over the next several years, Amanda quickly noticed Brooksville Main Street partnering with the City of Brooksville, Hernando County, and local businesses to enrich the community. She wanted to be part of that, so she started volunteering for BMS in different capacities. She saw a call out for board members and applied. Amanda joined the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors in 2021. Amanda currently works full-time as a public school teacher at Brooksville Elementary School. She is a member of the American Legion Auxiliary Unit 99 and serves on the City of Brooksville’s Parks and Recreation and Beautification Boards. “I donate my time and talent to Brooksville Main Street because I want my son and our community’s kids to be proud of their hometown. There’s something special about Brooksville and I have no doubt that Brooksville Main Street is and will play a key role in fostering Brooksville’s success.” Keith Marcelle, Board Treasurer & Organization Committee Co-Chair Keith is the proud owner of Marcelle Enterprises LLC. He graduated from LSU in 1998 and has lived in Hernando County since 2005. Keith values his family and friends above all else and greatly enjoys connecting with our community through all of our local events. Mandi Dixon,  Board Member Mandi is a dynamic force in the music and entertainment industry with a profound love for small towns and historic buildings. While in Nashville, she took her love for music and culture to the next level by founding Mandolin Entertainment, a venture where she worked closely with acclaimed artists and continued to make a mark in the industry. Her experiences in Nashville only deepened her affection for the rich history and unique architecture found in the city's historic buildings. After returning to Florida in 2018, Mandi embraced motherhood, and small-town life while falling in love with historic preservation. Mandi's expertise spans management, branding, public relations, and event management, making her a respected figure in the industry. Her unique blend of professional acumen and heartfelt appreciation for the beauty of small towns and historic buildings sets her apart as a dynamic and multifaceted individual in the world of music and entertainment. Lee Johnson, Board Member Lee has been involved in the city since 1998, living downtown and running a BMS district business, Downtown Loser, with her spouse, Celeste.  They have four adult children, six grandchildren, and two dogs Sophie and Coco.  Lee likes playing the ukulele and pickleball, and also enjoys traveling and photography.  Her favorite BMS program is Friday Night Live (which takes place in Hernando Park so she could play pickleball or play the ukulele or take photos while she enjoys the concert)! Barbara Manuel, Board Member Barbara came to Brooksville in 1966 when she married her husband, Steve. He worked at HHS as Band Director and she taught Chorus for many years, but when they retired, they took over the local radio station.  They’ve expanded that to three stations over the years, and in her spare time, Barbara managed the inaugural BMS Promotion Committee and single-handedly raised $46,000 for our holiday decorations. That makes the December activities Barbara’s favorite BMS program and she loves watching how much people enjoy downtown during that time. Shalamar McNair, Board Member Shalamar moved to Brooksville when he was five andgraduated from Hernando High School in 2000. He left that year and has been back for 14 years. In the last four years he has turned to a sober life (May 3, 2020) and has been VERY active in the community since. He was the main stage DJ at Lead Foot City, before construction started. He is the main DJ for Hernando County Boys & Girls Club. He is a member of the Greater Chamber of Commerce of Hernando County. Last he owns his own business, Shal’s Mobile Services Inc and DJ Shalamar - a DJ and entertainment company. He’s been DJ’ing for 24 years and also holds a Masters in Executive Management! In his owns words “I’m excited to be apart of the Brooksville Main Street board because my life now is all about the pay it forward vibes and giving back to the community.” “Let make memories through gathering in our beautiful community of Brooksville, Florida.” Justin Noe, Board Member & Economic Vitality Chair WIth years of experience investing, buying and selling homes across the country, Justin’s dream has been to share his knowedge and expertise with others on their way to achieving their own real estate dreams. He is a husband and father first, as well as a Marine Corps Veteran with more than 20 years of honorable service. Justin is an active real estate agent at Agile Group Realty in the Nature Coast area, a real estate investor, a co-founder of Twin Pillars Investments, Brooksville Investment Group and the Real Estate Co-Op. He grew up in Brookville and joined the Marines at age 18. The Noe’s journey moved them cross-country 4 times, to 6 diferent states, 14 different homes before returning to his hometown. Jennifer Rey, Board member & Organization Committee Co-Chair Jennifer has been in Brooksville since 1986, with a few years in the middle spent in Wyoming.  She is Managing Partner at Hogan Law Firm..  She is always willing to lend a hand unless the Tampa Lightning is playing - then we have to wait!  Jennifer most enjoys our Christmas on Main Tree Lighting and organizing kids’ activities in the Hogan garage during BMS events. Christie Williams, Board Member & Design Committee Co-Chair Christie has lived in Brooksville her entire life. Go Leopards! For the past seven years, she has been an active member of the Greater Hernando Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors and is proud to be serving as Board Chair for 2024.  She currently serves as a Board Member for BMS as well as Design Committee Co-Chair. Christie has a degree in Commercial Art and Graphic Design, along with  20+ years of Parks and Recreation experience combined with more than 35 years of Hospitality. She currently works for the City of Brooksville as Retreat Manager of Chinsegut Hill Retreat. This past year, while serving on the Promotions Committee, she jumped in with both feet by taking on a lead role  for BMS’s Christmas on Main Street celebration! Christmas on Main Street holds a special place in her heart. Her great grandmother used to play Santa Claus, and some of Christie’s cherished memories are from those festive days. Bringing that same joy and magic to our community is incredibly meaningful to her. She’s excited to serve on the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors and looks forward to continuing to make our town a wonderful place to live and celebrate.  Being part of the "Brooksville Renaissance”, she can't wait to share her vision with the community! Casey Thieryung, Board Member & Promotions Committee Chair As a lifelong resident of Brooksville, Casey is a committed community leader, local business owner, and passionate advocate for historic preservation. He owns the Red Mule Pub, a landmark sandwich shop that has served the community for over 45 years, and brings years of local knowledge and experience to the Brooksville Main Street board. A former member of the Brooksville City Council and active member of the Brooksville Rotary Club, Casey has a long-standing record of civic involvement. He also holds an FAA Part 107 drone pilot license, bringing a modern and innovative perspective to community development. Above all, he is proud to raise his family in the town he loves—with his wife, their daughter, and a second child on the way. Casey is honored to help shape a vibrant and enduring future for downtown Brooksville.
